page.title: 01Introduction 1
page.content: Wareham Lady St. Mary _introduction ----------------------------------- In the South East corner of Dorset near to Poole Harbour you can see the small market town of Wareham with a population of five to six thousand people. The town is flanked on it's North and South sides by the River Piddle or Trent (North) and the River Frome to the South. The town is situated on the junction of two roads (A351 and A352) which meet in the middle of the town. The area of Northport which is half a mile North of Wareham has greatly expanded over the last hundred years from the construction of the London and South Western Railway in 1847. Since the l950's many new houses have been built and a small industrial site is flourishing.
